documents.title: new £ 3.5m food and drink academy to open
text: a £ 3.5m academy offering training for students wanting to get into the food and drink industry will be the first of its kind in northamptonshire .
producers and manufacturers will also use the food and drink innovation centre at moulton college to develop new products .

the further education college 's vice-principal , gerald davies , said the next nearest centre is in cheshire , meaning food producers will not have to travel so far to do development work in the future .

documents.title: rail plans to close road for seven months
text: a busy road linking irchester with rushden will be closed for seven months from today .
the b569 station road will be shut as part of network rail plans to electrify the line to corby and install an additional track between bedford and kettering .
the closure will be in place until november .

documents.title: jeremy hunt praises county council service for disabled adults
text: the health secretary , jeremy hunt , has sent his personal congratulations to northamptonshire county council after the authority 's shared lives service was rated as `` outstanding '' .
the service , which provides long- and short-term support in a family home environment for adults with disabilities , was praised by the care quality commission in january .
in a letter , mr hunt said he knew the `` immense amount of hard work '' behind the rating `` can not be underestimated '' .
elizabeth bowen , county council cabinet member for adult social care , said the letter `` is much-deserved praise for the brilliant work '' of staff and carers .
author: Craig Lewis
BBC Online East

documents.title: county council 'inventing ' unitary plan 'as we go along '
text: northamptonshire county council will back plans for two new unitary authorities for the county , according to a leaked email .

in it , the county councillor responsible for local government re-organisation , andy mercer , said there will be a `` light touch '' consultation adding the conservative-run authority was `` inventing a lot of this stuff as we go along '' .
last month a government-appointed inspector recommended scrapping northamptonshire 's county , borough and district councils and replacing them with two unitary authorities .
in the email , mr mercer said he strongly believes there will be local consensus on the plans .
mr mercer told the bbc when he referred to a light touch consultation he simply meant there would not be a referendum .
author: Sam Read
BBC Radio Northampton politics reporter

documents.title: hoodies attack man with metal poles in northampton
text: a gang in hoodies armed with metal poles attacked a man in a car park at a northampton supermarket .
the 25-year-old victim was walking through the car park outside the co-op on fieldmill road , bellinge between 21:45 and 22:00 on saturday when he was set upon by up to 10 masked people .
he suffered head injuries and a broken hand , northamptonshire police said .

documents.title: hunt for 'psychopath ' animal killer spreads to bedfordshire
text: an investigation is under way in bedfordshire following the deaths of three pet animals in the past six months .
police have promised they would be `` keeping tabs on your tabby '' under a new probe - operation cosmic .
the force has been contacted by people concerned about fatal attacks on cats and other pets around the m25 .
the so-called m25 cat killer is believed to have slaughtered around 400 cats and small animals , leaving their bodies in plain sight in order to `` horrify '' people .
police said they were hunting a `` psychopath '' who kills the animals with a blunt force before mutilating them .
operation cosmic will investigate links between the deaths of two cats and a rabbit across bedfordshire .
other forces - in london , hertfordshire and northamptonshire - have their own operations related to the killing of pets .
author: Patrick Byrne
BBC News

documents.title: surgery after stomach stabbing
text: a man needed surgery after he was stabbed in the stomach following a row on a northampton town centre bus .
police have released cctv footage in a bid to track down two men wanted in connection with the stabbing outside steffans jewellers between 20:45 and 21:05 on tuesday .
the 25-year-old victim is believed to have been in some sort of altercation with two other men while travelling into town on the number 1 bus from the east of northampton .
when he got off the bus , he was followed and a further verbal row ensued after which he was stabbed in the stomach .
the offenders then ran back up wellingborough road .
the first offender , who is believed to have stabbed the victim , was white , in his early 20s , slim and about 5ft 7in .
he was wearing a light-coloured top with the hood up under a black jumper and black trousers .
the second man was white , in his early 20s , about 5ft 8in with short dark hair .
he was wearing a black jumper and light-coloured joggers .

documents.title: burglar jailed over car boot kidnaps
text: a man has been jailed after a series of burglaries during which he and two fellow thieves shut people in the boots of their cars .
the crime spree began in ware in hertfordshire at about 10:00 on 3 january when the trio forced open the rear patio doors to a property and stole £ 1,725 of jewellery .
after trying to trick an elderly woman in saffron walden in essex , they ended up at the home of a disabled man in hertford heath where they stole thousands of pounds in cash .
in baldock in hertfordshire , they threatened a man in his home and shut him in the boot of his car which they then used as a getaway vehicle .
swapping cars again in old welwyn , they shut a woman in her boot and drove off .
both cars were abandoned and the victims escaped .
james connors , 49 , of no fixed address , was eventually stopped behind the wheel of a car as it made its way towards northampton .
he was jailed for nine years at st albans crown court after pleading guilty to conspiring to burgle , two offences of kidnap and dangerous driving .
the other members of the gang remain at large .

documents.title: oundle crash death man named
text: a man who died following a collision in oundle , northamptonshire has been named as 23-year-old stuart randall .
mr randall , from bourne in lincolnshire , died following the crash on monday , 2 april .

the incident took place on the a605 when the silver ford fiesta driven by mr randall , which was travelling north , collided with a silver renault scenic and a grey honda crv travelling in the opposite direction .
five occupants of the honda crv were taken to peterborough hospital with serious injuries .
the two occupants of the renault scenic were not injured .
author: Craig Lewis
BBC Online East

documents.title: st edmunds retirement village work to start
text: work to redevelop the old st edmunds hospital site in northampton is set to get under way .
the current building has stood empty for 20 years and has changed ownership several times .
rochmills group , which took ownership of the wellingborough road-based listed building in 2016 , says it will be converted into a 130 apartment retirement village and a 62-bed specialist care home .
it is expected the work will take two years to complete .
councillor tim hadland said it was terrific news , adding : `` making the area look more alive is bound to be good . ''
author: Craig Lewis
BBC Online East

documents.title: county athletes set for 2018 commonwealth games
text: three athletes from northamptonshire will be among more than 4,500 from 71 nations and territories competing at the 2018 commonwealth games , which begin on australia 's gold coast today .
swimmer ellie robinson , 16 , from northampton - a gold medal winner at rio 2016 - will compete in the s7 50m butterfly on thursday .

also representing the county are england basketball player shane walker , 30 , from northampton and 18-year-old kieran rollings from kettering , who is the youngest member of the english lawn bowls team .

the opening ceremony for the 21st commonwealth games takes place at the carrara stadium from 10:00 this morning , and the first gold medal will be contested in the women 's triathlon at 00:31 on thursday .

documents.title: jimmy floyd hasselbaink sacked : who will take over ?
text: it 's the morning after the night before for northampton town fans , with jimmy floyd hasselbaink sacked as the club 's manager after nine games without a win .

the league one side face a struggle to avoid relegation , and easter monday 's 2-0 defeat at local rivals peterborough proved the final straw , with the cobblers 22nd in the table , two points from safety , and having played more games than their rivals .

dean austin , hasselbaink 's assistant , and jon brady - the former brackley town boss - have been placed in charge until the end of the season , but that has n't stopped the bookmakers getting to work .
one market has ex-scunthorpe manager graham alexander as favourite , while caretaker austin is also listed alongside the likes of uwe rosler and steve cotterill .

the incident happened at 18:06 yesterday on the a605 at oundle when a silver ford fiesta , travelling north , was in collision with a silver renault scenic and a grey honda crv travelling in the opposite direction .
the driver of the ford fiesta was declared dead at the scene .
five occupants of the honda crv were taken to peterborough hospital with serious injuries , one potentially life-threatening .
the two occupants of the renault scenic were not injured .

documents.title: we like big boats and we can not lie
text: `` it 's not what we usually do `` say road policing officers as they prepare to escort a rather big boat across parts of east anglia .
this one 's going from oundle in northamptonshire , along the a605 south to the a1 at st neots in cambridgeshire , then through cambridge city centre before heading for the suffolk coast .
it 's the `` most convenient route avoiding high bridges and tight bends '' , officers from the bedfordshire , cambridgeshire and hertfordshire road police unit say .
the officers accompanying the boat are volunteering for the task on their days off , and the cost of the trip is not funded by the `` public purse '' , they 're keen to point out .
they probably just like big boats

and if that 's the case , it 's their last chance to escort one this size as the manufacturer - fairline yachts - is moving part of its business to a new facility in hythe , southampton water , where its larger vessels will be built in the future .
last 78 foot yacht built by @ twitterid leaves # oundle .
larger models will in future be built at new site in # southampton more @ twitterid @ twitterid
after watching look east i really would n't want to follow that ship by road .
awesome as it is .
yes our cameraman actually got stuck on his way to the next job !
a slightly different job for the road policing unit today , ensuring the safe escort of this yacht through the county on its journey to suffolk .
what 's the route will try to avoid nothing personal mind
a605 to a1 , south to st neots , across to cambridge and through the city centre .
the most convenient route avoiding high bridges and tight bends .
have fun .
do n't go through a drive thru .
i ca n't help but feel this is not the best use of resources
the officers are working their rest day , the funding does not come from the public purse .
no arguments here then !
nice boat !

documents.title: time to 'look to the future'northamptonshire county council statement
text: a northamptonshire conservative peter bone says it is now important to `` look to the future '' , adding that any new structure must be driven locally .
he also wonders whether the cabinet and committee system was one cause of the council 's problems .
mr javid agrees that any reorganisation must be `` locally led '' .
as for the cabinet system , he says it is an issue that any review will examine carefully .
author: House of Commons
Parliament

documents.title: sajid javid accuses labour of 'political football ' over northamptonshirenorthamptonshire county council statement
text: sajid javid accuses labour of not listening to his statement and wanting to play `` political football '' .
`` if he 'd read the report he 'd see it 's crystal clear there is not an issue of lack of funds , '' he says .
he specifies that if commissioners are sent in it will be by the end of april , and he does not intend to give more resources to northamptonshire as this would be `` rewarding mismanagement '' .
author: House of Commons
Parliament

documents.title: inspector report makes for 'very sorry reading'northamptonshire county council statement
text: shadow housing , communities and local government secretary andrew gwynne says the council inspection report makes for `` very sorry reading '' and is an `` indictment '' of mismanagement locally and eight years of austerity nationally .
he recalls that in 2015 , the local government association said that spending reserves to provide services was not the right thing to do .
he says the council was cutting the ribbon on a new £ 53m office building as it was preparing to announce itself bankrupt .
mr gwynne says the national audit office has said that one in 10 councils with social care obligations will have exhausted their reserves in the next three years .
he asks what contingency plans the government has for other councils in danger of facing the same problems .
he adds that redrawing the boundaries of the council area , as proposed , would not solve the underlying issues the council faces .
`` northamptonshire is the first , but will not be the last , '' he states .
author: House of Commons
Parliament

documents.title: northamptonshire county council failings not due to lack of funding - javidnorthamptonshire county council
text: housing , communities and local government secretary sajid javid says that the situation in northamptonshire is `` concerning '' .
auditors at the council had previously signalled that the authority was not managing its services effectively , he states .
and these concerns prompted him to act , he adds .
mr javid commissioned a report on january 9th and the final report was submitted on 15th march .
mr javid says that the inspector has identified `` multiple apparent failures '' in complying with their `` best value '' duties .
he says the inspection concludes it is `` not down to a lack of funding '' but identifies difficulties wiht oversight and `` blurred '' accountability .
the council did not respond well to either external or internal criticism , mr javid says , he adds that the `` hardworking staff '' at the council are not at fault .
the problems are `` so deep and ingrained '' that it would not be feasible to try and fix them , he states .
he is `` minded '' to take control over the council to `` stabilise '' the authority .
author: House of Commons
Parliament

documents.title: cctv images released after robbery at northampton store
text: cctv images of two masked men police want to speak after a robbery in a store in stanley street , semilong , northampton , have been released .
two men , one holding a large handgun , entered a convenience store wearing face coverings and gloves between 21:10 and 21:20 on saturday .
they made threats with the handgun to staff inside the store before stealing cash , cigarettes and alcohol .
the men in the or anyone who recognises them are asked to call northamptonshire police .

documents.title: new cabinet at troubled northamptonshire county council
text: a fresh cabinet team has been named to take under-pressure northamptonshire county council `` into a new period of transformation '' .

the changes come in the aftermath of a damning government report which recommended the authority should be scrapped with two new unitary authorities created to replace the county and district councils by 2020 .

the county council , which recently approved £ 40m worth of cuts for 2018/19 , could be taken over by government commissioners if the report 's recommendations are taken up by secretary of state for local government , sajid javid .
heather smith , leader of the conservative-controlled authority , resigned following the publication of the report , while finance cabinet member robin brown was sacked .
matthew golby ( who is currently acting leader , is expected to be confirmed as council leader next month .
his new deputy will be cecile irving-swift , who has no previous front bench experience .
she will also serve as cabinet member for public health , while michael clarke , who has previously served as member for highways , returns to the cabinet to take over the finance brief .
mr golby said his team `` combines some experienced cabinet members with some new talent '' .
author: Craig Lewis
BBC Online East

documents.title: brackley town to play at wembley stadium
text: brackley town have reached a wembley cup final for the first time in their 128-year history .
the national league north side beat wealdstone 2-0 on saturday in the second leg of their fa trophy semi-final to win 3-0 on aggregate .
they will face bromley from the division above them in the final on 20 may .
it also means a second attempt at winning the final for brackley manager kevin wilkin , who was a beaten finalist with old club wrexham in 2015 - who sacked him the following day .

documents.title: work starts at derelict northampton hospital and workhouse
text: some building work has started on the former st edmund 's hospital in northampton .
the victorian building has been in a poor state for years and there are plans to build a new care village on the site and renovate the listed building at the front .
when the plans were unveiled in 2015 , developers said much of the building , designed by architect george gilbert scott , would be retained .
the hospital and former workhouse was closed in 1998 and has since become a target for vandalism .

documents.title: film crews come to daventry for latest nativity movie
text: daventry is to appear in the next film in the nativity series of movies .
a film crew spent the day in the main shopping area recording scenes for nativity rocks !
- the fourth in the series .
director debbie isitt said shopkeepers and shoppers in the town coped well with the demands of filming and were `` absolutely amazing '' .
she added : `` it [ daventry ] has a lovely community feel to the whole place .
we 'll definitely come back and film again . ''
the movie is due out in late november - just in time for christmas .

it comes after a highly critical report said the authority should be scrapped .
council leader heather smith ( resigned in the wake of the report , while finance member robin brown was sacked .

in a statement , the authority 's acting leader , matt golby , said the tory group `` has moved swiftly to take on board the criticisms '' made in the report and are determined to `` lead the recovery process '' .
he added a fresh leadership team will soon be revealed , including `` new and currently untapped talent combined with the valued experience we have available '' .

documents.title: council review £ 5m loan to neighbouring authority
text: the leader of leicestershire county council has reassured taxpayers it will get its £ 5m loan back from northamptonshire county council .
the authority lent its neighbours the money but now northamptonshire county council is facing allegations of financial mismanagement .
a report last week recommended it should be abolished and replaced with two unitary authorities .
so what does this mean for the money leicestershire lent them ?
well , byron rhodes has told the bbc : `` i appreciate that there is some disquiet and we 've taken action to carefully review the loan .
`` our professional view is that despite northamptonshire county council 's situation , there is no realistic prospect of the loan not being paid back . ''

documents.title: tory mp congratulates 18 labour mps over russia motionbusiness statement
text: conservative mp peter bone congratulates 18 labour mps who have signed an early day motion in support of theresa may 's decision to expel twenty three russian diplomats , following the poisoning of a spy and his daughter in salisbury .
the move appears to be a snub to labour leader jeremy corbyn , who has questioned whether the nerve agent attack was the work of president putin 's regime .

the motion was tabled by john woodcock , an opponent of mr corbyn , and `` unequivocally '' accepts the `` russian state 's culpability '' for the attack , and says it would consider supporting `` further proportionate action to deter future acts of aggression by the russian state '' .
author: House of Commons

text: parents across england and wales have been fined about £ 24m for failing to send their children to school during the past three years , it has emerged .
a bbc investigation also shows some councils are issuing penalties at rates five times higher than the average .
here are the figures for the strictest authorities in the east of england and the numbers of fines in the past three full academic years .

documents.title: northampton theatre given £ 684k to produce new shows
text: northampton 's royal & derngate theatre has been awarded £ 684,000 to create four original musicals , a festival to showcase new productions and to support new writers and composers .
the money from arts council england will be used to produce new shows suitable for touring at medium-sized venues across the country .
james dacre , artistic director at royal & derngate , said : `` we shall support at least 150 artists to create a diverse range of truly original new work .
these are exciting times . ''

peter knott , from arts council england , said : `` the financial and funding context in northamptonshire is challenging for arts companies like the royal & derngate , so it 's great to see such ambition and enthusiasm which will bring interesting and diverse theatre to new audiences . ''

officers searched a house in whitworth road on sunday and found cannabis plants worth about £ 85,000 and cocaine with an estimated value of up to £ 8,000 .
the 19-year-old man has been charged with possession of a class a substance with intent to supply , production of cannabis and possession of false documents .

documents.title: anti-fracking protesters guilty of obstructing highway
text: two people have been found guilty of obstructing the highway in the first trial of anti fracking protesters in north yorkshire .

york magistrates ' court heard how last october , 40-year-old julia collings of row road , northampton and 52-year-old ronald holloran , of suddaby close , hull , sat on top of the wooden tower on a road near the proposed fracking site in kirby misperton .
they refused to come down in a stand-off with the police .
they 've both been sentenced to a six-month conditional discharge , and each ordered to pay costs of £ 220 .

documents.title: people in daventry warned to 'avoid ' smoke from fire
text: northamptonshire fire and rescue service has warned people in daventry to `` avoid '' smoke from a warehouse , which is still smouldering after a large fire on sunday night .
a spokesman said : `` while the smoke is not toxic , residents are advised to keep it out of their homes by keeping doors and windows closed .
`` they are also advised not to expose themselves to the smoke unnecessarily and not to breathe it in . ''
more than 50 firefighters were called to the building in parsons road , which is owned by garden centre suppliers gardman , and the roof appears to have collapsed .
a man has been arrested on sus of arson .

documents.title: wooley mammoth tusk to be auctioned in northamptonshire
text: an `` extraordinarily rare '' 10,000-year-old woolly mammoth tusk is to be sold at auction in northamptonshire .
the 220cm ( 86.5in ) -long item , which is exempt from the ivory ban because it is from an extinct species , is said to have been discovered in siberia in the 19th century and carved in china .
it was purchased by a private buyer in new york in 2009 and is estimated to sell for up to £ 40,000 at humbert and ellis auctioneers of whittlebury near towcester on 5 april .
auctioneer jonathan humbert said : `` this really is a thing of utter beauty and we anticipate much global interest in this very statemental piece . ''

documents.title: raped woman married-off for money and visa , court told
text: a woman who suffered a head injury when she was raped was married-off by her father for money , a court heard .
the marriage also took place to improve her husband 's immigration status , london 's court of protection heard .
mr justice baker decided the islamic marriage was `` arranged entirely '' by the man and the woman 's father .
he said the marriage took place at northampton islamic centre when the woman was vulnerable to influence and ruled it was invalid under english law .
the woman , who can not be identified , has links to london and northampton .

documents.title: cupid cop gets colourful with pen present
text: a kindly northamptonshire copper who last month made a st valentine 's day card for an elderly man to give to his wife - because he could not afford to buy one - has been rewarded for his community spirit .

pcso andy emberton played cupid to the 74-year-old man by getting him a cup of tea at the force 's northampton community hub , and drawing a valentine 's card for the man to sign and take to his wife .
at the time , pcso emberton said he wished he had more pens at the hub so he could have made the card more colourful and guess what happened next ?
yes , a member of the public read about his good deed and sent money for him to buy some coloured pens .
`` this really shows the power of social media and was such a lovely gesture , '' says pcso emberton .
`` since valentine 's day , i have seen the elderly gentleman who said that his wife was absolutely over the moon with her card . ''

documents.title: northamptonshire county council loaned £ 10m by oxon
text: northamptonshire county council has borrowed another £ 10m from a neighbouring authority - the second council to confirm it loaned cash to the bankrupt local authority , the bbc has learned .
it emerged on wednesday that leicestershire county council loaned the council £ 5m in january .
and now oxfordshire county council has said it gave £ 5m in october and £ 5m in december .
northamptonshire county council has been forced to impose a spending ban on itself to balance the books for its 2016-17 budget .
it has also just approved £ 40m worth of cuts for next year .

councils can not borrow money to run everyday services , but northamptonshire county council says the loan is for `` cash-flow purposes '' and that it is `` normal practice '' for local authorities to lend each other money .
the oxfordshire loans are due to be repaid in july and september , and the leicestershire loan in january 2019 .

documents.title: consultation dates for rail central freight terminal
text: a second round of consultations on a giant strategic rail freight terminal in the south of northamptonshire is set to get under way .
the rail central scheme was first proposed in early 2016 , and a first set of consultation events took place that year .
the proposals would see developer ashfield land build an eight million square foot ( 743,200 square metre ) freight hub linking rail and road routes on land between blisworth and milton malsor .
it would include warehouses , a lorry park and a service depot .

the new consultations feature changes to the original plans including replacing a proposed roundabout with an underpass , restricting vehicle movements at the site 's junction with towcester road to emergency vehicles only , and introducing parkland close to the a43 .
details for highways works will also be published including proposals for substantial changes at j15a of the m1 .
the fresh dates are :

documents.title: domestic abuse refuge for men opens in northampton
text: the first refuge centre for male victims of domestic abuse in northamptonshire has opened .
it will be one of only nine centres in the uk to cater exclusively for men and will accept referrals from all over the country .
it is estimated that 450,000 men are victims of domestic abuse every year and figures from northamptonshire police show that a quarter of all reports of domestic abuse in 2015 came from men .
yesterday , the first refuge of its kind in the county opened - a house , consisting of three rooms , exclusively for men , which can accommodate children too .
the refuge will be a place where male victims can seek help and support , whilst they are found somewhere more permanent if required .
author: Anna Bartlett
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: it 's not only the weather conditions our paramedics are battling
text: it 's thieves too .

east midlands ambulance service says a satellite navigation system and a mobile data terminal screen , used to send information to clinicians about the location and condition of patients , were both stolen from an ambulance parked outside a home in corby in the early hours .
the crew returned to the ambulance to take the patient to hospital only to find all the cupboards in the ambulance open and the electrical equipment missing .

lee brentnall , ambulance operations manager for northamptonshire , said : `` this senseless act means that the ambulance had to be taken off the road to have the equipment replaced , and ca n't respond to emergencies .
whoever did this clearly did n't think of the impact that their actions would have on their community .
`` while every effort has been made to replace the equipment as soon as possible , the incident will have an obvious impact on our ability to respond to patients .
`` i would urge anyone who saw anything sus or knows who could be responsible , to please call on 101 and quote incident 1800009472 . ''

documents.title: northants 'no new spending ' rule to remain until april
text: the section 114 notice imposed on northamptonshire county council by its own chief financial officer will remain in place until at least the end of the current financial year .
councillors today agreed to accept mark mclaughlin 's report on the notice , which prevents all new spending , except on statutory services .
conservative council leader heather smith has said savings already made as a result of the notice had been `` insufficient '' and that it needed to remain in place .

the labour opposition leader , bob scott , asked how councillors could set a budget for next year when there is n't a balanced budget for this year , while the liberal democrats ' chris stanbra questioned how much money had been saved already by the notice .
today 's council meeting had been expected to set a budget for 2018-19 , but that has been delayed on the advice of the local authority 's auditors .
author: Craig Lewis
BBC Northampton

documents.title: northamptonshire county council budget 's 'serious ' consequences
text: the consequences of ignoring an advisory note from auditors kpmg are `` unpredictable '' , but would be `` serious for all of us '' .
those were the words of northamptonshire county council 's chief finance officer mark mclaughlin at this morning 's full council meeting , where it was due to set its £ 435.54m budget for 2018-19 .
that has been delayed after kpmg issued the advisory note on tuesday evening .
mr mclaughlin said the advisory note will not `` stop the democratic process '' , but added that the authority must now produce a `` robust and realistic '' budget .
he also discussed the s114 notice he himself issued earlier this year which prevents all new spending at the council .

mr mclaughlin said the financial situation at the council , where he projected a £ 21.1m overspend for 2017-18 , is `` the worst in england '' and the worst he has seen in 30 years of working in local government .
author: Craig Lewis
BBC Northampton

documents.title: wadebridge sculptor creates statue of suffragette mp
text: a cornish sculptor has created a statue of a prominent suffragette on the 100th anniversary of women first being given the right to vote in the uk .

richard austin from wadebridge was commissioned by northampton borough council to design a 7ft ( 2m ) sculpture of margaret bondfield , a labour mp for northampton who became the first female cabinet member as well as co-founding the first trade union for women .
mr austin says it is a great way to mark such an important figure .
`` northampton borough council has been amazing , '' she said .
`` it 's unprecedented in commissioning a sculptor to create seven life-size sculptures of important people from northampton .
she 's the final one .
`` it 's fantastic that she 's such an important lady from northampton and especially in this year of 100 years of women getting the vote . ''
the sculpture joins six other famous northampton figures commissioned by the council - francis crick , lady wantage , edgar mobbs , walter tull , john clare and malcolm arnold .
margaret bondfield 's statue will be unveiled at northampton guildhall on 20 march .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: corby urgent care centre plans to be scrutinised
text: the future of corby 's urgent care centre will be discussed at a public meeting at the cube this evening .
about 70,000 people a year have been getting healthcare by turning up at the centre on cottingham road , but under new plans they would have to book a same-day appointment by calling their gp first .
the nhs corby clinical commissioning group said the new system would help direct patients to the right part of the nhs for treatment and reduce a & e attendances at kettering general hospital .
a public consultation will begin next month and , if approved , the changes will be implemented in april .

documents.title: hello - is this what you 've been waiting for ?
text: fans of lionel richie will be `` dancing on the ceiling '' to hear the us singer-songwriter is hitting the road in june for a string of gigs .
and he 's kicking it off in northampton !

his franklin 's gardens gig on 1 june will be the first of a string of dates including stops in perth , hove , lincoln , shrewsbury , leigh , carlisle , scarborough , chesterfield and london , where richie will play at hampton court palace festival .
the singer , famous for hits such as hello and dancing on the ceiling , said he was looking forward to seeing `` parts of the country i 've never made it out to before '' .

richie will no doubt be welcomed and embraced by the good people of northamptonshire , and perhaps when he returns to the us he 'll speak well of it to other stars such as hollywood actress lindsay lohan , who sort of promised to turn on the christmas lights in kettering , but did n't quite manage it .

documents.title: couple campaign for nhs tests for baby-killing bacteria
text: a couple from desborough have set up a campaign calling on the nhs to provide expectant mums with a £ 35 test for a potentially-fatal bacteria in unborn babies .
group b streptococcus is carried by one-in-four women and can infect a baby 's lungs , blood and brain , though only about one-in-2,000 newborns falls ill because of it .
amanda osbourne and jason barnes 's daughter mia died from the bacteria four years ago , and they believe she would have survived if they had been given more information about it .
mr barnes said : `` it 's very clear the uk does have a problem in awareness of infections such as group b strep .
`` a pregnant lady is not screened for the infection as part of her routine anti-natal care and that 's something we believe needs to change . ''

documents.title: travel : delays between northampton and watford junction
text: there are delays affecting london northwestern trains between northampton and watford junction this morning , due to a fault with the signalling system .
disruption is expected until 10:00 .
due to a fault with the signalling system between northampton and watford junction services running through these stations may be delayed
that 's a long stretch of track !
can you be more specific please ?
hold ups seem to be happening at northampton .
the 8.22 from mkc was on time until northampton , now it 's just 'delayed ' .
that is the only information i have at the moment i 'm afraid
is the delay on the 8.22 's arrival to mkc because the additional units at northampton were n't ready on time ?
there is no reason being given at mkc .
not it is due to a signalling issue
that 's not what the guard on board is telling us !
: ) he 's saying the extra units were delayed on arrival to northampton , and that sounds about right .
apologies , the guard is correct on this one , sorry for the misinformation hannah
thanks , that 's okay !
at least i know one way or another .
that 's the important part from a passenger perspective - just knowing what 's wrong .
i appreciate that it is important , apologies once again for the delay hannah
my 10:44 from canley to euston was cancelled .
if i get to coventry can i get a virgin train ?
apologies for the cancellation , however , your tickets would not be valid on a virgin train i 'm afraid
so as my arrival time will now be over an hour than planned would this qualify for your refund criteria ?
you are entitled to can claim compensation for your delay , you can do this here
always an excuse .
sorry you feel it is an excuse , however , when there is a signalling issue it unfortunately causes delays
every single day we have to put up with poor service .
so yes it does feel like an excuse .
hi , i 'm a reporter at the watford observer .
are there still delays at watford junction or are services back to normal ?
thanks ,
there are still some delays of up to 10 minutes for services running through that station
okay thanks for letting me know .
normal day then
every day this week there 's been a signaling problem on the wcml , will @ twitterid ever improve ?
yes they are replacing the old clapped out bits a bit at a time unfortunately this is not a quick process unless you can just shut the entire wcml for a couple of months
they might have well have done as they took a big part of birmingham ns out for 10 days at xmas .
new kit being lifted into place with old kit in the background

documents.title: maids moreton murders : one man released under investigation
text: police investigating the suspected murder of two neighbours in maids moreton , buckinghamshire , have released a 22-year-old man under investigation .
he was being questioned on sus of fraud .

two other men - a 27-year-old from towcester , northamptonshire , and a 31-year-old from redruth , cornwall - are still in custody after thames valley police was given more time to question them on sus of murder .
peter farquhar , 69 , died on 26 october 2015 and ann moore-martin , 83 died on 12 may 2017 .
a murder inquiry into mr farquhar 's death began in march 2017 , 18 months after he died death but just two months before mrs moore-martin was killed .
